title: Mage champions worth trying for a newcomer?
body: So i'm a newcomer to LoL and I have a group of friends, one of which has been playing for 2 years and counting so they all know a lot more than me, but I have a feeling their bias towards certain champions and tactics are interfering with the way i'd like to play the game and what champion i'd like to play as, i've always been a mage guy, because magic attacks are always so much god damn cooler, mages are my favourite in any game that has them, screw swords and bows off, magic all the way. So, LeBlanc looks pretty good, so does Malzahar, I really like their move sets and feel that with practise i could become quite skilled with them, but i have a hunch that when i query my friends on these suggestion they will automatically activate their bias and their opinions on those champions and their favourite ones will just turn me off using them and they'll make it seem like my choices are just bland and stupid. I'd like to hear from some other sources, are these champions worth trying for a newcomer, and if not then what are some good mage/magical related champions you'd recommend for someone who's willing to spend money (a little) and time to learn them and their abilities well. Thanks in advance :D

replies.body:
Yes, mages are amazing at mid, got a fighter on the enemy team? You got an advantage, I'm thinking of saving up for Viktor, or Orianna, both are amazing at mid.
LeBlanc is one of the hardest Champions in all of League, I questioned it too, but I figure that everything comes with practicing to make it perfect :D 
Mid and Mages FTW
Thanks everyone for the suggestions, i've gotten my hands on Malzahar and Caitlyn and i'm quite liking both of them, despite caitlyn not being a mage but anyway, thanks again. :D

Yea I remember when I first started out back in season 3. My friends that got me into it were like veterans (season 1 and 2). So they usually made it hard to really do much without criticism. But if you really want to get the most out of the game, play the way you want to play cause you will get better for it and feel better about it. Their input is good to gain knowledge but if you like a champ just go for it, you will decide whether or not it fits in with your play style on your own.
play whoever you want to play. I'd suggest annie, she's strong and fairly easy to learn.
Twisted fate, passive makes you want to cs well, long range harrass with q, infinite mana+easy last hitting with w, free damage passive with e, global pressure to help team.
How about Morgana? She's only 1350 IP, has an obvious combo to work around (Q->W) and can be played either solo or as a support.
Veigar, it teaches you how to cs
